attributes.action: views of people in England should be recognised with regard to the Scotland Act
attributes.additional_details:
A study carried out by University of Cardiff ,shows that parts of the Smith Commission  on the new Devolution of Scotland Act is directly against the majority of the will of the English population  
The views of people in England contradict some of the key proposals for the future of Scotland put forward by the main pro-union parties. Funding  Scotland via the Barnett formula appears inconsistent with public opinion in England.  Scotland  £10,327, compared to the UK average of £8,940.
attributes.background: By a margin of more than four to one, voters in England believe that levels of public spending in Scotland should be reduced to the UK average therefor the fiscal framework support of the the Barnett Formula principle within the new Scotland Act is against the will of the people of England

rejection.details: You could start a new petition calling clearly for a specific action, such as changes to the Scotland Act.
